CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, June 13, 1953, pg. 3, reads: "Head Life Guards At City Pools - An institute for lifeguards who will work in city swimming pools this summer took place Tuesday at Ammon pool. This year marks the first time Negro head guards will be used at any pool other than those patronized principally by Negroes.  John D. Myers has been assigned to Pleasant Valley pool on the North Side, A.J .Allen to Paulson, Terence L. Garman to Ammon and Oliver L. Thompson to Kennard.  In addition to these assignments two Negro guards have been sent to Highland Park.  Six others drew initial assignments to other pools. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of seventeen men, most City of Pittsburgh lifeguards, possibly including John D. Myers, A.J. Allen, Terence L. Garman, and Oliver L. Thompson, posed at Ammon Center pool
